original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up in mid-day trade, rupee at 321.20/50 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond and t-bill yields were up in the mid-day trade on Thursday, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 28.10/40 percent, up from 27.90/28.20 percent from a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 26.10/30 percent, up from 25.90/97 percent.
The one year bill was quoted at 22.90/23.00 percent, slightly up from 22.70/23.00 percent from the last close.
The rupee quoted at 321.20/50 to the US dollar in the spot market slightly depreciated from Wednesday’s close at 321.00/30 rupees. (Colombo/April20/2023)
